inclusion.criterion: ischemic stroke diagnosed by CT or MRI
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: first stroke onset or past stroke without obvious neurological deficit (mRS≤1)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Time from onset to treatment: ≤ 4.5 hours
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Treatment with intravenous rtPA or urokinase
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Signed informed consent by patient self or legally authorized representatives
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: History of subarachnoid hemorrhage, intracranial hemorrhage and hemorrhagic cerebral infarction
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Obvious head injuries or strokes within 3 months
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Intracranial tumor, arteriovenous malformation or aneurysm
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Gastrointestinal or urinary tract hemorrhage within the previous 21 days
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Heparin therapy or oral anticoagulation therapy within 48 hours
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Oral warfarin is being taken and INR>1.6
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Severe systemic disease which is expected to survive less than 3 months
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 62-year-old African-American man with left upper and lower extremity weakness, associated with dark visual spot in right eye, right facial numbness, facial drop and slurred speech. He has hypertension, hyperlipidemia and hypothyroidism, smokes 1 pack per day for 40 years and consumes 5 to 6 beers per week.
